intro: Pseudobetckea, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Pseudobetckea species are shrubs or small trees, often with a spreading habit, and they play a role in stabilizing soils in their native habitats.
